text.name: sys_description
text.text: Released in 1987 in Japan, the PC-Engine (TurboGrafx-16 in America) is the 8-bit console of NEC Corporation. This is their first console, and outside of Japan and North America the console, little or not distributed, has known a confidential existence. It has a 16-bit graphics processor that has often been confusing. It displays a resolution of 256×240 to 512×240 pixels in 32 colors out of 512, with a 6-way stereo PCM sound. With its game library of more than 600 games, it is known for its excellent shoot them up as Gunhed and Parodius, but also PC Kid, Cadash, Devil Crash and Bomberman 94.
